column4: Hi. I downloaded the 11.10 live cd, and upon startup, all i get is a screen with options to install, recover etc. I never see the option to "try it". have i downloaded the wrong iso?
Possibly, what exactly are the options?
i'm asking about the .iso file dyou downloaded, not the CD.

try running the Install Ubuntu option from the liveCD, if it spawns a nice gfxical envronment then it should be  a desktop one, if not ,it might be an alternate or server CD. abort the installation before you reach the disk partitioner.
also, only desktop CDs have Try Ubuntu option..
yes, you dont need a reinstall, just find out what CD you have.
It should have the try ubuntu option.
You'll get the try ubuntu option only when you boot from the live CD.
You will NOT get it if you boot to GRUB or an already installed system.
No, it's not what you think it is, I thought you wanted to boot to a live environment right ?
Why do you want to boot to a liveCD when u already have an installed system ?
your current user is guest, what happened to the user created during installation ?
what user did you use in the recovery mode /
okay, so did u try sudo passwd root ?
